Sasha I hope you never need to leave. I love this place and will recommend as a first choice to just about anyone. Vegan or not!

HORg44iDjSX2zAlS_1_5ag.text: I really love the atmosphere of this place. Awesome staff. Awesome food. My only complaint would probably be that the portion sizes are bit small.

eoFs7kYPVvgRcZVel9OT_A.text: This used to be a 5 star from me as the food is usually very good and completely vegan with gluten free options that are cooked to order, not the typical gluten free default breads and tortillas that other places use.    The reason for this review though, is that the place has really been off their game lately.  This is so sad because I want to love them and I keep giving chances almost weekly! All summer I have been going there, but more than 75% of the time they are closed during hours that their website and yelp state should be opened.  This is beyond frustrating as they are across town for me and also I have tried to bring a few different friends from out of town only to get there and have to find another place.    usually when I get to eat there, the food is phenomenal; however, I have noticed portions getting smaller and smaller and when the owner is not there they always "run out" of gluten free bread (which is made to order so read: don't feel like mainf it).  Finally, I went yet again today to order my favorite thing, the "BLT gluten free", which I have ordered for four years now, and it was literally about a quarter of the size that it used to be.  I could have eaten it in 3 bites and it was $12.50!! I never usually complain but I did ask if I could either get more or be charged for a half order, since that is what I got.  They were nice and gave me another micro mini sandwich but they both were completely undressed and very different from the usual deliciousness.  They were mediocre at best.  I'm really disappointed and after 4 months of really unfortunate disappointments, not sure I want to keep giving chances to this place... Ugh there goes one of the few vegan options I have... Really hope they get it together Bc I miss 24 carrots!

PaQvQNRRNEMhU6dLBfhhoA.text: Food is not organic. Workers lied about the food, they said they used organic house vegan milk but they didn't. They used conventional processed milks. We had stomach aches from their tea. Their raw food are not 100 percent organic which causes more problems in human health. Increased pesticide use in the conventional produce will make us sick. So this place sucks.

5NmWPwj4L4CaUm3wBALzVw.text: Nice environment! The people are very inviting. A wonderful alternative to the regular options available.

xnu685BsiPM9daCqKNi-YQ.text: No. No no no.  It's places like this that give veganism, vegetarianism, and frankly vegetables, a bad name.   We went here for Mother's Day and boy was it a mistake.   We ordered the hummus to start which had about 1.5 tablespoons which wasn't even enough to dip all the vegetables we were given. Also it wasn't good. I had the BLT which was bland and had a weird taste. I also ordered the apple soyrizo hash which had no soyrizo in it and when I asked I was told it's just the flavor. Well then don't put that in the name of the item and also then where is the flavor coming from??   My brother had the avocado quinoa bowl and it was tasteless and missing items like black beans and my mom had the blueberry French toast... The toast was literally just toasted and there were barely any toppings, in fact she had to ask for more to make it edible. Also the free mom-mosa that was to come for my mom took 45 mins: ridiculous.   Apparently the smoothies are good so my recommendation is - make it a smoothie bar... Smoothies, coffees, dessert.. That'd be great.  But don't do food. I cook vegan food and it can be delicious. This was not that. And it was way overpriced for what it was.   Someone did come over to ask us how it was and when we told her she offered to refund us, which we declined, or give us a gift certificate which we did accept.. But that's always like cool your food was bleh gimme more! We may return to try something else but well see. Not in a rush.   We got Baskin Robbins after. Can't go wrong there.

tPSu4LXicYmfk1BtNNDypA.text: I finally found this place again after they moved!  It's a bit hard to find actually.  I had driven by it for weeks until I made the effort to figure out where it was.  They only have a banner in the window and the door is hidden behind an alcove on the end of the shopping center so it makes it pretty hard to see driving by.  They are in the Trader joe's shopping center on the opposite end.  Hopefully they are getting a new sign so that people can find them.  I will have to say they are 100% better in the new location.  The staff is super friendly and helpful, there is plenty of room and the food service time has been really fast the four or five times I have been. They keep the web site updated with their menu since it rotates from week to week which is always nice to be able to check before heading over.  Keep up the good work.  Try:  - Raw "PASTA" Marinara

FYpL8efsB-h0MtXJ-V_XqA.text: Yum! Love their juices & smoothies. No artificial Jamba crap here. Real fruits & veggies, real fruit juice and the way they make their smoothies thick is to add frozen fruit instead of ice. The secret.  Their menu changes weekly, so that can be a good thing, but alas it means you can't get the same thing twice. Their raw sushi one week may be outstanding, the next week just okay. I've also had their quesadilla, which has also varied in quality. Hopefully they will at some point settle on a few fixed entrees the way Green has. I don't want to stifle the cook's creativity, but I also want a meal I can depend on to be delicious.  Love the new space. Congrats on the upgrade!

pFDHh4OtDGW-an1DYSkWmA.text: I always forget to take pictures! Have been here several times and always enjoy it! Most recent visit was 6/29/17. Some dishes we've tried: Dan Dan Noodles, jewel kale salad, Buddha bowl and garden burger (daily special varies) the bowls (Dan Dan & Buddha) are really the stars of the show here. I'd recommend starting there. Salads are good. Burgers, honestly I'd pass on them. Desserts, smoothies and teas are all great! Husband especially likes the PB & B. I like how big the Iced tea selection is. Last visit I had the cookie bar with salted caramel icing. Yum but super rich! We've exhausted the kids menu, but unfortunately my toddler won't touch it. I think that's more about her than the food. I've tried her meals and they're okay. Customer service here is excellent! The space is a good size and they have a play area for kids, which as parents of a young child we love! I haven't been in for breakfast yet, but based on the pictures I need to make that happen. Definitely check this place out!

Zf2eZK5i6AjwwUeVRXE5Vg.text: My entire family loves eating here! So healthy & delicious....my favorite is the Buffalo cauliflower wrap & a hummus plate...so so yummy! My 6 year old love their vegan cheezy noodles with fresh fruit. I love their water with various fruit & cucumber and the glasses in mini mason jars. Everyone there is super nice & helpful. A very chill atmosphere but you can tell they are passionate about good healthy food. So happy they are here in our community! Great job 24 Carrots!

J3TnIx8gNsfFAcDSBkajOw.text: My wife and I went in around lunch time. There was literally no one there and no one acknowledged that we were there for several minutes. There was only one item in the entire glass case. We stood around awkwardly until we saw the laminated menus in the holder on the wall.   We decided to try a juice before we ate so I ordered a carrot-orange juice. It was about $5 and came out luke-cold. I felt pretty disappointed at that point to we left.   It is a really cool looking place but the service and food seemed really sub-par, especially for the price. I see a lot of positive reviews so I may try this place again but my time there was definitely a 1-star experience.

T_6jJFFzVN1gARiKYx47QA.text: 24 Carrots is a rare commodity in the modern world of restaurants, where most food is factory farmed, highly processed, and prepared using nutrient stripping, unhealthy methods.    I have been eating their fresh and ever-changing food creations as well as drinking their fresh juices and smoothies for several years, dating back to their original location in Chandler.    It is really nice to see them expand into this new location in Tempe, where they are growing and getting the exposure they deserve.  They offer healthy, delicious options for raw, vegan, and gluten free eaters.    Sasha, the owner, took time to sit with me and give me valuable tips and suggestions for choosing to go on a raw cleansing diet.  Very warm, knowledgable, and hospitable.  She even let me try a raw dessert on the house!    I give this restaurant five stars and would love to see it continue to grow and succeed.  It may be slightly more expensive than your average lunch spot, but the quality is noticable if you know what's good for your health.

R3bQTBsyhrEk9DPsUMY9XA.text: I loved you the first time I visited a few weeks ago and now you disappoint me. You're out of almond butter which was the highlight for one of your breakfast selections and subbed peanut butter. Not the same!! The smoothies were just as good as the first time, but the fruit on my breakfast was a bit lackluster. I want to love you again and will try one more time hoping for the glory of that first time.

0oxtw6hbiQIRnV21fHEo3g.text: Like the new location!  It took us a while to come back after they moved!    We've been here twice in 2 weeks and have been very pleased!    Pros:  Much bigger menu - lots to choose from, from more "junky" vegan to raw vegan. Tons of smoothies and juices Good coffees and teas We've had 6 different menu items - and we've been happy with them all.  Cons: Lots of chalkboard menus with squished writing - bring your glasses! Extremely laid back atmosphere, we're cool with it, but strange for people who aren't.  Note:  Food does take a bit to come out - we actually like this - that means they are cutting up everything fresh to get to you!

1BPYAbRpJgs2O95De5Ew1Q.text: I really love this place. The food is fresh, creative and excellent. I love the Smokey TLT with avocado. The tempe 'bacon' is made on premises and is crunchy and delicious. There are also wraps, plates, bakery items and more.  Their juices are interesting combinations of fruit and veggies that are delicious and filling.   The owner, Sasha, came to our table to greet us and insure all was well. Very nice lady who is dedicated to healthy eating and quality organic ingredients.   Great place for vegetarians, vegans, raw foodists, gluten intolerants and many others with dietary restrictions or preferences, and it tastes good for "regular" folks too.   The only two downsides are probably unavoidable. Number one, it is rather noisy with the blenders going to make the juices and smoothies, and no soft surfaces on the floors or walls to absorb the sound. The other is the price. This is not a cheap place to go, but you get what you pay for and I believe the value is there.  Best to luck to 24 Carrots in its new location!

fZ8ukR43s5yosIE5JbmL0g.text: I really enjoyed this place. I ordered a carry-out but the dining was very appealing. Had I not been in a hurry I would have stayed. The Masala Chai (hot) Tea was really yummy. Even for a 100 day.  Ordered the zucchini noodle salad but received a zucchini salad. It was still good, just not what I ordered. I tried the gluten free lemon and cookies and cream cupcakes. (I believe both kind were gluten free) For a dollar you can't beat it. They are soooo great with tea... Just dangerous Bc you can eat a million of them. I also couldn't help myself and ordere the gluten free carrot cake. OMGGGG it's so damn good! Everything was so good I don't even care my order was wrong... I mean I do care but you get it. (Posted a few days after visit)

yM3y1UEQzDsTS0SpAJKBxA.text: I believe this is their new location. I ordered the triple threat acai smoothie and it was refreshing and full of flavor. Unlike a lot of smoothies I've tried, with each sip I was able to identify all of the different fruits in this drink. $14 for two medium smoothies, a bit pricey for drinks but I made sure to sign up for the free rewards program. They texted me a voucher for a free iced tea for my next visit which is a plus! Will be coming back to try their food next.

vIH1cklVWXW4V4EcRF2nzA.text: Thanks to the foodies on Yelp, I was able to at least find the correct corner of 24 Carrots new location!   The house vegan blt was tasty.  The bread was toasted just right and the beet soup was vibrant in flavor!  I would order this again!

f2nT1gGeBKgfiogyX_udbA.text: Sasha and the crew have done an amazing job with the new place, and the food just amazing as it was at the previous location. I'm excited for them and I'm excited to have 24 Carrots closer to my work. Thank you Sasha, Amanda, and all the rest of the crew (both new and continuing).

5MnCcWIwSRpTLvu1OikXWg.text: Best vegan/vegetarian place in Tempe! Everything is great on their menu! However my favorites are the Incrddible Hulk smoothie, their pastries, and jalepeno poppers. You won't be disappointed with anything though!

1Ss5_n7IgYj-uY8KcWJ4bA.text: We went here based on the rave reviews of a co worker. The original location seems to have been in Chandler on Chandler Blvd, but that placed closed so we had to come here.  I ended up getting the nachos, my co workers got the quesadilla and one of then got a protein soup. When the soup came out it was deep purple! However my friend reported that it tasted fine... my nachos were decent but tasted more like Indian chaat than nachos (fine by me).   They have a large selection of smoothies and their menu changes frequently. I'll be back if I'm in Tempe again.

uKwkT7OXY1O2qBub04iX8Q.text: Yes it's pricey and the service is a bit show.  But the collard wrap with side salad ($10) was very good and a decent portion.  And they have sriacha too!  I hope this place makes it but would advise some more reasonable priced options.

MblHhknOJqw-khB6e6VjEg.text: I love local small cafes like this. Everyone was super friendly and even educated me on some great vegan teas and coffees I'm excited to try the next time I stop by. Great food. Great vibes. Great people! I would highly recommend and already have to some of my coworkers! Vegan or not you'll love this place!

gK79auNsM-jH8h0WMoNG1w.text: Ten bucks for a juice is quite pricey and I think it was mainly cucumber juice. It's a nice place but other juice bars are 20-30% cheaper and a better selection.  The do have beer though.

-rEaOZjNMT0FhYE1UXwWOA.text: Very friendly and spacious place with good energy. I came on a Tuesday morning and it started getting busy.   I have been to many vegan places and honestly they are all usually good but what is awesome about this place is that there are a TON of options.  I really had a hard time choosing but really just wanted a smoothie so I had the Good Juju - peanut, chocolate, cinnamon, banana and hemp. It was delicious. The lady working there talked me into a chocolate pumpkin cake too which was also good :)  I really wished I would have tried their food while visiting Phoenix. Oh well, next time.

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Good Juju :)

WuJtsxrO7VYzG4gH-lMkwg.text: So Good! Fresh juice. Spicy Bloody Mary. A vegan Breakfast Sandwich with so much flavor. Don't sleep on this vegan Spot.

KfQB-VNxva-Jd-8wCPDOxw.text: Do NOT come here if you're looking to just grab something and go. Great healthy options in a relaxing atmosphere but service is incredibly slow. Like I'm talking 20 minutes to get a smoothie slow. But it would be a nice place for a slow brunch or lunch.

OJwyaM02EKAO9akCt9bndg.text: Calling all Vegans ... this place is the bomb. Well worth a drive to enjoy fresh amazing ingredients and laid back atmosphere. They have the best hummus I have ever had. And love their vegan tacos, fresh juice, teas and lattes. Just a mile or so off the 101.   PS... even if you are not vegan you will love it.

qDG0gh9TTn3AA4Ags_m7CA.text: Went here today for the first time and I am now obsessed. My husband and I shared the Bountiful Collard Wrap and the Smokey BLT Club Sandwich - both were delicious. The veggies were fresh and all the sauces were tasty and perfectly proportioned. I want to try everything on the menu!

XOSngeYgyND0rJ7K25bZjQ.text: I had their jackfruit tacos and I fell in love! If you order here make sure you have time I noticed is always takes 25-30 minutes which is fair for food being made when ordered. I also ordered 3 smoothies didn't  like any of them. I had the rejuvenation smoothie, the chocolate smoothie, and I don't remember the 3rd ones name but it had acai in it. They were just not for me.   My boyfriend had there green Chile tamale tacos and he hated it said it was bland, and overpriced.  My son had the cucumber humus, he also was not a fan.   I'm the only vegetarian on the household so I love finding places like this but if my men don't like I probably won't go back.   It is very over priced tho, for three people (and one was off the kids menu) I paid $60 and it literally a walk up stand nothing fancy.

7r5_Q4bbc2zB9C9e8FS-jw.text: Top vegan restaurant in the valley. The owner is so sweet and staff are always nice. Everything that I've ordered has been so good and FLAVORFUL. Seriously obsessed with their portobello cheesesteak sandwich and BLT.  Ughh I got to go get one tomorrow just thinking about them.

tcRF4710TLFTfQk9i30RkQ.text: We tried this place for the first time today for lunch and we were really impressed. I ordered the double stack tostada special and my boyfriend ordered the meatloaf tacos. Both items were exceptionally yummy, made with very fresh tasting ingredients and the meals were filling without over doing it. While we were there the owner stopped in and checked in on us. I also ordered the orange juice which tasted as fresh as when we squeeze our own juice at home. They squeeze their juice daily. I also had the vegan and gluten free brownie, which was yummy. We will be back. The menu had quite a few items we'd like to try.

5vhZK82fcYa6lwL6vEX7lA.text: Sasha ~ this is for you! If you want to lose your restaurant, continue to have an uncaring staff and manager. Not a table clean, employees standing around talking. It took forever to get our food and $4 for a 16oz cup filled with huge ice cubes all the way to the top. Ice tea was NOT freshly made (which I expect when paying that kind of a price with no refills... big no - no, poured from a pre-made container (it tasted old!)... When I complained about the 4oz tea with 12oz of ICE, I was told sorry, no refills unless I want to pay ANOTHER $4!!! No thanks. Even though the food was good (although no where stated where any of the organic food was sourced)... when a restaurant is in desperate need to rip off customers without a care... that's where I draw the line. Needless to say, No recommendation here! Obviously, I will not be back!

n6U1a63iXI5I777gWidF5g.text: This is a vegan restaurant that has acceptable food, but sanitation is an afterthought.   Companion, who is vegan and I went for breakfast. Decor is sparse, but acceptable.   Food seemed a bit pricey for what you get, but not having a whole lot of experience with vegan restaurants, I'm not sure what the going prices are for food such as we got.  What I found very objectionable, was sanitation. One of the servers had long dreadlocks, but no hair covering at all. This is unacceptable in any place that serves food. Worse still, companions food had 2 hairs in it.  Rather than complain and take a chance on eating food that is contaminated, we both left immediately and found a different place to eat.   Not recommended

xF_LDlQ2saII0EyuXAIBgg.text: Well, I see this place bought a ton of Yelp advertising, which included the decent of the Yelp minions, again, coincidentally ALL thought this juice shop in a Tempe, Arizona, strip mall, is a 5 Star place. Don't get me wrong, I have nothing against 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe, but 5 Stars? Just look at the photos. To me, this place is 3/5 Stars, but I love their big helpings of fresh veggies, their local do-good story, and their HUGE DETERMINATION to succeed. I love the "Do whatever it takes" can-do attitude. 24 CARROTS JUICE BAR & CAFE: THEIR STORY 7 years ago, Sasha got thirsty. Really REALLY thirsty. And so, she began on a quest to quench that thirst. But everywhere she looked she was faced with the same problem. Drinks, juices and smoothies filled with artificial ingredients and excessive sugar. Realizing the serious need for a healthy and tasty snacking alternative, she came up with '24 Carrots.' In 2007, she was joined by her best friend and cousin, Shyam, who brought with him a wealth of business intuition and a very discerning palate. THE STORY & SERVICE EXPERIENCE I was first introduced to this place because of my trainer. My trainer is IN LOVE WITH JUICING and LOVES this place. When we went in, I was nonplussed. It just doesn't seem like a place where I'd usually hangout. That's just my personal bias though. The fresh treats refrigeration display only had a 1/2 of a carrot cake and was storing some ingredients that weren't for sale. The menu is on a chalk board. I ordered the Voodoo Child juice. It took about 10 minutes to receive two juices and a piece of carrot cake to-go. We subsequently tasted the carrot cake and it didn't taste that good to me. My juice was served room temperature/warm. Maybe I'm too picky, maybe I don't like my juice warm, but it made it difficult to drink. In the juice's favor, it was JUICE juice, not a smoothie, meaning it's made with REAL food, not with sherbet or excess sugar fillers. CONCLUSION I've been several times, mostly because it's close to my home, I love their commitment to healthy food, and I do love supporting deserving local business. 4/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Plenty of parking out front. *For more information: 24cartotsjuice.com

uKGmJeR-iMGKJhhsx4gqBg.text: I was in this afternoon about 12:15 pm on 10/17/18 order a bowl of split pea soup and  a sloppyJoe taco  Sarah served me the watered down split pea soup and laid down silverware on table.  I picked up a dirty sticky spoon with dried food on it.  I alerted Sarah to the unclean spoon as well as a knife was dirty.  Sarah exchanged them with an indifferent attitude.   I asked her if they wash their silverware here.  She ignore me  at first then I asked again caught her attention at the  cash register on my way out.  I asked her if they use a dishwasher to clean their dishes she states "we have someone to wash the dishes". I got clarification that their dishes are washed by hand; therefore, there is NO dishwasher machine to sterilize.  I could not finish my meal and left.  I will never return to this unsanitary place again filthy   I mentioned to Sarah that I will report this incidence to the Public Health Department.  I did asked to speak to her manager Sasha who was not in today she states "I don't know when she will be in"  Overall bad experience unclean lousy food paid $20 for something I couldn't stomach eating  Beware of this place  Questionable unclean conditions  at a high price   JM

huuryLdxX4coUPvxHiMThA.text: I got the burger and it was not as hardy as I thought it would be. It basically tasted like a lentil patty. On the side there was a small salad, for dessert I got the lavender chocolate cake which was decent but the slices were very small. Nothing really special on the menu and it is overpriced.

a4qdEUVp02OxPHtkDMZXEg.text: I love this place! The options are super vegan and vegetarian friendly, and they are super delicious! Customer service is amazing too! The Harvest quesadilla is a personal favorite

4XBlaBr170REeV5WcbUAkg.text: Food is amazing. Staff is excellent. I had the Buffalo Califlower wrap. It was amazing!! Good atmosphere.  Lovely vibe. Will be back

uwT6jJnXgp6-83cqwPpLHw.text: Food was great! Got the Nashville Hot Chikn....so good! Highly recommend! My wife is vegan and she loved it!

g6x6xwqhZSfXYjZXmJ3kVw.text: On the pricey side of vegan restaurants in the valley, but one of the better ones because they use more veggie protein and less tofu, and very fresh ingredients. The menu has such a wide variety that you'll have trouble deciding; plus they have daily specials. We ordered ceviche tacos and a banh mi from the specials board, and a buddha bowl, and everything was delicious. The berry and berry+beet smoothies were really good, too!

fMnCI_PbIir8HbUbx1ym8w.text: First time visiting this spot in Tempe and I got the BLT with hummus and carrots was $10.99  and my husband got the Gardeners Tofu scramble with potato hash, vegan bacon and fruit $11 with cheese for and extra cost. The food was good but for the price you do not get much for example my husbands plate looked like a kids portion. I am not sure that it will be put in our regular vegan rotation but I would return again if I am in the area for nothing else but to try one of the juices.

aITiGIRdFhxbfZSAOutmNA.text: A few years ago, I did a project where I made a database of vegetarian and vegan spots around the greater Phoenix area. This was on the list and I've had it bookmarked since. I was across the street from it and made it over to order an early dinner.   It wasn't busy when I arrived and I took a look at their menu on Facebook before I came. I was confused that the regular menu didn't show up on my phone (I think it's the file type) but looking at the website, it's there. I ordered their garden burger, which was made with a black bean burger, tomatoes, greens, a blackberry chipotle sauce, and topped with a "jalapeno popper". It comes with a choice of side and I did a salad. I also ordered a campfire brownie, which looked really good in the case.   This place definitely has a hipster vibe to it and there is a lot of seating. The cashier who rung me up wasn't friendly, nor was he rude. I got my food within 10 minutes and it was just handed to me. The worker at the coffee spot was chatting with a customer for a while. Sometimes, you get a feeling about a place or about people and I was not impressed. When I got home and began eating my food the only thing I enjoyed was the brownie, which was pretty delicious and authentic for being vegan. The salad was literally just greens, so nothing special. The vinaigrette was pretty good though. The burger was not very good. The bun was soft, and I would've liked it to be toasted, and the patty itself was soft and not flavorful. The lettuce was almost too crunchy. I know I seem picky but I personally didn't enjoy the food. Pair that with the lack of customer service and I won't be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Campfire brownie
Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Garden burger with jalapeño poppers and greens

wqOMV3hW_UhotjX1XvXwig.text: The juice I ordered was grainy--like the produce wasn't cleaned. I'm more than willing to try more there but I was disappointed by the quality of the juice seeing as it's so expensive.

eLIPkq3Y_lNrAcQdKhVMOw.text: I was really excited to try this place and Dan Dan noodle bowl sounds and looks really good (on Yelp pics) but when I got mine, it shocked me, in a bad way. The picture I took was before I had my first bite. But the noodle looks much darker than other pictures here. And it was EXTREMELY salty! I thought to myself it's okay just drink water because I don't wanna bother them... But after three bites I can't stand it... :( I'm sorry I really want to like this dish, but it's just too much for me. It was nice tho they made me another one with soy sauce on the side so I can add it myself. It's much better.... I would recommend you get soy sauce on the side and add it to your taste. Other than that things are good. And I may try some other things here again. So 3 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Dan Dan noodle is really salty. Ask to put soy sauce on the side is better :)

S_u29ZYOtCTidpG6j_wu4A.text: SO GOOD! I was so excited to find out there is a good all-vegan restaurant here in Tempe! As a new vegan, I'm still learning about all the great types of food there are, and 24 Carrots is a great place to try new things. I took some friends for breakfast and we got the breakfast burrito, Arizona Bowl with cauliflower, and the french toast. Everything was flavorful, fresh, balanced, and DELICIOUS!  I am a total caffeine addict, so I also got a soy latte with date caramel- Holy deliciousness! Really rich and decadent. They also do fresh juices and smoothies.  The cashier was really helpful and knowledgeable when I asked him about some of the dishes and their ingredients, and the staff checked in often to make sure we were enjoying our meal.  The limoncello cookie sandwich was amazing as well, we all split it for dessert. A great, casual place to bring friends and have an amazing healthy meal. We will definitely be back!!

aTRVW43Yha9VPPbyrjcTSw.text: I love this restaurant! Every time I go the food is delicious, fresh and so flavorful!!! Going more plant based eating isn't so hard when you have an awesome place like this to eat and learn from!! The staff is very kind an knowledgeable!  Can't wait to go back!! Ginger

-Wek16g-9rs6-8984GRT5A.text: The Vegan Breakfast burrito is DELICIOUS!  Best vegan dish I've had in 6 months of eating Vegan.  So grateful for this place!!

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vegan Breakfast burrito and &#34;Field of Greens&#34; juice. Perfect breakfast!!

x7Jg2FWIKSJG_dnX5e4gyQ.text: What a shame that this place suffers because of the lousy service.  As a vegan from San Diego, I seek out local veg*n restaurants like I did this weekend in Phx. 24 Carrots is very close to where I stayed and I was excited to try the cauliflower breakfast burrito.  The gal taking our order was completely insouciant, barely verbal, and quite rude. I decided against ordering a meal and instead settled on an almond milk latte and spicy chocolate cupcake.  After waiting 10 minutes and noticing no one working on the latte, I asked the gal about it. Apparently she had buried the order with all of the others so we had to wait even longer. No acknowledgement or apology.  The cupcake was dry and not much better than Whole Foods's vegan pastries.  A $4 cupcake should be moist and tasty.   What is really unfortunate is that I brought my mom, an omnivore who is curious to try vegan cuisine. She was so turned off by the negative experience that she will not be back. And she lives around the corner.  Take a cue from Nami, people. Improve your customer service and desserts.

Midbyfct8USWUPaIwfnYww.text: I love the atmosphere of this place and I really hope it thrives long-term. I also think this section of tempe is a great location for the demographic they are catering to. That being said, the three star rating is on here with my willingness to return and hopefully update my review and increase stars. My experience on the customer service side was overall pretty poor. I arrived, and was a little taken aback by all the options and I had limited time so I went with soup and a hummus/veggie plate. They had two soups listed on the chalkboard but they were out of one. Which is fine.... But its a chalkboard, so just erase the unavailable soup. I even suggested it, but was either ignored or maybe she didn't hear me.  I get my soup and its the one they originally told me they were out of. Luckily I was hungry and they both sounded delicious so I went with it. It was a ginger coconut carrot something or other. Very good!!!! It was sweet and I'm thinking with coconut milk and extra agave added and some apple juice (as she explained was part of the soup base) - might be vegan but probably high calorie and definitely high sugar. Very gingery but also very good. Was just puzzled at the mix up that they never quite admitted to.  Anyway..onto my hummus/veggie platter. I was one of two patrons there. My hummus platter (hummus and veggies) took about fifteen minutes. It was bewildering. I was so hungry and didn't want to continue eating the high sugar soup so I just waited and waited and listened to the several staff folks just banter with each other. I was very frustrated. Even if the hummus is prepared fresh per order..it still took about ten minutes longer than it should have.  It was good, full of great veggies and portion of hummus was generous which made me happy.   It was the inexplicable long wait and weird inaccurate communication about the soup that drops this review from four to three stars. However I am excited to come back and hopefully be proven that this was a one-off. Luckily the food seems great so I'm optimistic that customer service concerns are resolved.

mVD4vJjTIRtT5jnf9uojng.text: Amazing, fresh, healthy, local menu. One of the few places I can eat out while still honoring my many dietary restrictions. Helpful and friendly staff. Yummy desserts. Great specials. I have a hard time just ordering one meal here, i usually have to order multiple desserts to go at the very least. Can't speak highly enough of them. Amazing house-made gluten free bread option.

jyAo3sVt3MC2INjnTK7byQ.text: So damn good! This was my first visit here and I am absolutely in love with the place. It's beautiful and bright inside. The food is creative and delicious. The juice is as fresh as fresh can be. Prices are reasonable for a vegan joint, which sometimes can be more than I would wish to pay. The patio area is absolutely adorable. I want to recreate it at my house. There are fresh herbs outside that don't disappoint. You can smell the basil as walk past into the front door. Local ingredients are used whenever possible which gains major bonus with my husband and I. Another thing I really loved, there were people of all ages here. It's not just any "hipster" place. A lot of vegan places get a reputation as "hipster." 24 Carrots did not disappoint!

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chocolate Chip Pancakes
Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Vegan Breakfast Burrito
Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Juice and smoothie menus.

IRB7LPGR7mllTSjZUxHPOg.text: EX-SQUEEZE ME, how is it that I didn't know sooner that this lovely cafe exsisted?? I had not seen it before on my many trips around the corner to Changing Hands Bookstore. It's tucked away like a secret, but this one is meant to be shared. A hidden hole in the wall of flavor and serenity this will quickly become my go to place! 24 Carrots is filled with vegan options for breakfast or lunch, gluten free goodies, coffee, tea, fabulous concoctions of fruit & vegtable juice and smoothies, friendly service, books and even a cozy corner to curl up and read in. They offer an irresistable shelf of books where you can take one home free with the promise if you take one you leave one. I enjoyed the Blue Pom Bomb a sweet mixture of blueberry, pomegranate, strawberry and apple juice and the potato leek soup,that came with a kick of spice, loved it! I'll definitely be back, not just because I owe them a book but there are so many delecatable delights to be had. That pumpkin smoothie is whispering my name.... I can't wait to return to this sweet escape of a cafe...

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Alright, perhaps just a little dessert! Coconut lime mini pie!
Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Potato leek soup ..
Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Take a book &amp; leave a book, great idea!

ehpoqHIAafD_bqX8_gFxjg.text: Had been to this place since my friend was insisting. The moment I entered the cafe, I was awestruck! Pleasant ambience, aroma of the organic food, soothing music, tasty yet healthy food- all that I could've asked for!! I sat on a couch next to a book shelf, where they also having some coloring books with crayons.. it just can't get better than this :)

4KlodcbtyGJI4gzOuLmPxw.text: Today was my first time in, so I had some questions about the menu. The cashiers didn't seem to know much about the menu, claiming they hadn't tried it yet. (My advise as a former restaurant manager: fake it until you make it!) I ordered the peach smoothie which was really good! I'll definitely come back because there aren't many vegan-friendly restaurants but I'd really love to see the service improve!

x2qCJM3KYRG6ppPkWT0ZfA.text: Cool, relaxed vibe with a great staff . I had the BLT it was delicious.

z7ZKF8yRLDvV_UyShQyO2w.text: My first experience here was not good but a I gave it another shot. The food is ok not bad and not great just ok so nothing to go out if your way for its also very expensive for what you get. I got the vegetable scramble from the breakfast menu and was disappointed in how oily everything was, barely any vegetables and ofcourse my order was messed up. The reason I am giving it such low ratings is when I asked twice when ordering whether a dish was GF and was told yes several times. When the dish came it had toast which was a main component and I again asked and ofcourse it wasn't. They then told me they could switch it for GF bread but I would have to pay for it even though it was their mistake! Good thing the nice guy at the register probably realized how ridiculous this was when I tried to go pay for it and told me to not worry about it. Sad to say I won't be going back as it just doesn't deliver in any aspects.

8EJ-9LLe1yIPaoTlXAXcuw.text: I want to love this restaurant. That's why I kept trying to go, even after I'd been disappointed several times. I like and want to support small businesses-- especially vegan businesses.   Unfortunately, the time it takes for food to get to me has always been too long (even at the old location). I absolutely agree with another yelp review that noticed that the prices are getting higher or staying the same while portions have been greatly decreased. The food is just ok.   For the same price I can go to Pomegranate and not be disappointed.

yvUcQ013dFq653RVl5ki3Q.text: Buffalo cauliflower wrap is great! Has kinda a Cajun tasting spice to it too. Definitely would recommend. This is my first visit but I'm excited to try more options for dinner!

6_J737m-88B9dbcNUxbjnQ.text: This place was recommended to me by a friend because I wanted to stop eating out during my lunch hour at food places that weren't so good. I figured with itthis place being healthy and vegan, it would be the new place for me. WRONG!  My co worker and I got there before the lunch rush and ordered. We waited 30 minutes for our food as shortly after we placed our order, the lunch rush came. The workers are young and look very lost as they're walking around. They moved very slowly with no energy. I wouldn't put it past them if it turns out they were all stoned. Customer service is not a priority for them. Even the food wasn't that good and overpriced for the quality. I won't be back.

Lgq3co15gZincxRQ1KvF1A.text: I love this place so much!!! I would eat here every day if I could afford to. Prices are good for decent portions of super high quality, fresh, healthy food. They change their menu every week, which keeps it exciting (although I've been longing for the Zucchini Noodle Alfredo to come back ever since I tasted it). My mom and I are addicted to their cashew cream sauce and anything made with it, although unfortunately they make more tomato-based items.  I've had Raw Tacos, Stuffed Tomatoes, salads and breakfast items and LOVED them all. I want to try every single thing on the menu. Oh and don't get me started on the dessert case! Incredibly delicious vegan desserts. As someone who tries to follow a natural, plant-based diet, this place is a dream!  The only negative thing I would say is sometimes service isn't great, and they'll let you stand at the counter for a while without acknowledgement. But some of the people there are sweet. Their juices and smoothies look great, but I make that stuff at home so I haven't tried them. And when I took my sister here, she stated that it was "too healthy" for her. That said, this is still a 5-star review because this place is fantastic.

VYKZUYXsDOp5DpakIMbCeA.text: Great place. As with most of the juice bars around the valley drinks are kinda on the pricey side but what you are getting is definitely a healthy FRESH drink. Cannot vouch for food but menu is totally vegan and vegetarian friendly. Very cute place!!

QEGk8sKlXkk_WfQL6ip8_g.text: I've been so curious to come here for the longest time and I am so happy I finally did. Wish I would have visited this place much sooner. I ordered the Arizona bowl, the Kapi coffee, and a raw pumpkin cheesecake. The BF ordered the French toast and the Gardener Scramble- delicious as well. Loved it all. I felt so good about what I was eating and it came out surprisingly fast. The Kapi was so yummy. I'll be back here regularly.

T5QWw-wkiuDT0Q04z2tl7A.text: Not just carrots.  But, all about healthy drink and food selections.  Even their coffee and teas are healthy organic.  I don't eat here as there is a restaurant across the street which has my current food attention.   My staple here is the Triple Threat, primarily because of the amazing health benefits of pomegranate juice.   Additionally across the street is a tan bed shop where my then girlfriend frequented nearly daily.  So, she would tan, and I would fest. Then we would met up at the frozen yogurt shop (her choice).  Then it would be hold on for dear life when she drove us off FAST in her sports car.  I paid the price for my younger years when I enjoyed speed. But, I was also at the wheel in those days.  Oh, back to the health shop/restaurant...great place. Expensive too. But, that's to be expected.  NOTE: read my other numerous reviews for tips, entertainment, and historic references. Thank you, Tim B.

X2HKWyY4dVqPIsjBlobCig.text: 8/20/19  I am one picky eater. I'm a chef myself and I'm very critical of food. This place was really really good! I had the Nashville hot chickun sandwich and a salad, my husband had the raw Alfredo zoodles. Both dishes were really good and full of flavor. For dessert we had a pumpkin pie snickerdoodle cookie sandwich and a campfire brownie. They were amazing!! I'm definitely going back to try some of their other dishes. I definitely recommend that you try it out.  8/25/19  Went back to try some more yummy food here, and it was disappointing. I had ordered the seasonal tacos and they were deep fried , but not correctly. They were soggy and super oily and lacking in flavor. I ordered an extra side of salsa and some ranch and the salsa needed salt and the ranch was watery and tasted like nothing and I had no issue paying for it but it was definitely not good. The rice and beans with the dish also were flavorless and sad. The desserts are decent and can be dialed in a bit and their juice was good even though they forgot we ordered it and brought it out at the end of our meal.  The complete flavor profile was lacking last night and I unfortunately have to change my 5 star review down to a 3 star review. Food and flavor need to be consistent regardless of your staff and time of day.

ILDn2JJx4AapLMqu4h1jfw.text: I am in Phoenix on a vacation and my hotel has slim to zero plant based options. I took an Uber ride out here and it was WELL WORTH the trip. I had the Arizona bowl, green juice and a coffee for breakfast, then I took a Dandan noodles to go for lunch later.   The owner is very nice and welcoming and you can tell that she put heart into this place. I will definitely be back. I should note that the food is authentic and delicious.

-ZEPa1pUmWKXEkTFMfN4zA.text: Every time I come to this place I get mesmerized with the food creativity from their daily, weekly, and weekend specials. This, and the friendliness of the owner and staff, is what keeps me coming back. I've been coming here for quite some time now and they added one of my favorite food items to the menu, the Sonoran Dog. When I tell you this was one of the most prettiest and tasteful things I've ever ate, BELIEVE ME!  Every single bite was a burst of flavor and I couldn't put it down. I'll be back to order it again. Bring your Omni friends.

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Plant centric inspired Sonoran dog with a side salad.

mTEdCct13Op4YYl_dHuvtA.text: This place is outstanding! I have been coming here for years. I love the food. I love the sustainability practices. I love the smoothies.   My son loves the donuts.   They are thoughtful in so many ways. I love the green smoothie and beet root latte

Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

KmxSZmYutS11kZLQAFWJeQ.text: I was really feeling up for something healthy and fresh, and we decided to venture over to Tempe to try 24 Carrots out. This place exudes good intentions, and I really appreciate that. The staff cares about the food they are serving and the causes they are supporting. Unfortunately, it is a little on the higher price end, and the desserts miss the mark. I feel very conflicted because I want to give all the stars for the vibe and mission, but the food is more like a three star experience. Really, I am a 3.5 here.  I went with the daily taco dish, which were vegan carne asada, made with seitan and mushrooms. They were delicious, although they were on the small side (for the price tag). It was served with a rice and beans mixture that was made with some type of green sauce that was quite spicy for me. (It might have been a coriander chutney.) i was surprised to get the rice/beans because the cashier asked if I was ok with a salad for a side. There was no salad, unless rice and beans is their meaning of a "salad?" My husband got the daily quesadilla, which was styled as "rice a roni beeph," and it was pretty tasty. He got chips and salsa with it, and that was a better side, in my opinion.  I really wanted a piece of chocolate cake for dessert, but they only were sold as whole cakes, unfortunately. I opted for a tiramisu cake, which didn't have much in the way of coffee flavor, and it tasted just like a basic chocolate cake with some cream topping. So, I guess I got my chocolate cake fix, but I would have been sorely disappointed if I was hankering for some tiramisu. I am not sure I would go back for dessert.  I WOULD go back for a juice, though. It was pricey - $9 for 20 oz, but it was delicious. I had a concoction of beets and ginger and other goodness, and it hit the spot. My husband did a green smoothie, and it was good, although not as great as my juice.   Despite the mixed review, I would definitely go back.

fLloGeXPl_X7EqmzKveObA.text: Adorable atmosphere and tasty vegan food. Got philly cheese steak- so flavorful and good! Also got potato soup- yum - and my green smoothie- tasty! They take vegan to an elevated level of flavor. If you are vegan get there immediately! Easy to eat AIP, gluten free and Paleo diets. Go now!

gopdt3lzdSFnC750WFJylA.text: I read some of the previous reviews that were anything less than 4 stars, and the complaints were "unsanitary" or "expensive". What these people don't understand is the entire concept of this beautiful, sustainable, and wholesome Vegan cafe that I adore.   I started coming here when I moved to Tempe after about 2012. I left Tempe in 2015 and forgot about this gem of a restaurant.  Don't come here for quick and cheap eats. Come here for vegan and gluten friendly soul food cooked with high quality ingredients and friendly caring staff.  I stopped in today for a quiet place to study as I was in the area unexpectedly. I had time to discuss food with the owner who was at the register herself a lot of the time today. You can tell she's so passionate about what she does and the food her team creates. It radiates.  I ordered the raw carrot ginger soup and the cold brew. Both delish and refreshing on a hot June day in Arizona. I enjoyed the atmosphere so much I stayed studying for several hours. I love that they have sustainable refillable water available for guests and I also was able to get silverware on my own. A not so friendly previous Yelper said dirty silverware made them leave. They much have never worked in a restaurant- because it happens. More than we all want to know or admit, but my silverware today was clean.   I enjoyed myself studying I stayed for a few hours and never felt unwelcome. I watched the lunch rush get handled with ease by the staff. They seem like happy busy bees running around. I used the gender neutral bathrooms several times. They were clean and well stocked. Low flow toilets with cute signs made me happy; again, about sustainable living and eco friendly awareness.  I had a friend call so decided to invite here down for lunch because hours slipped by and I was hungry again. She got Thai style peanut noodles and tiramisu and enjoyed it. I got the bean vegan burger special with GF bun and side salad. We both ordered and LOVED the real, traditional Chai   The owner even bussed my plate that was almost licked clean and chatted with us a bit more. Again, it made me fall in love with this place even more.   I'll be back and gladly pay the fair cost of the menu for such worthy ingredients and high quality from-scratch vegan goodness.  Thank you 24 Carrots. You made studying for nursing school super enjoyable today. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Carrot avocado ginger soup(raw), cold brew coffee and amazing free WiFi with plenty of chillax study space. Awesome ambience.

hI6-8bGt7HJfbWd0AwyOGw.text: Super fresh tasting, friendly and fast service. I was expecting to wait a while for my BLT Club sandwich but that turned out to not be the case.  It's wasn't busy so I was in and out pretty quickly!  I'll be going back again!

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Smokey BLT Club Sandwich with carrots and hummus.

W-b1JBRQsk6PHdnc8Wk2VQ.text: This was a surprise, and a pleasant one. Clean, excellent food and an informed and engaging staff. The Falafel Garden burger was moist and flavorful, wasn't stuffed with corn (no corn at all thankfully) and was accompanied by a small. fresh and tasty salad.  Easy to park too.

bSiNeLYdJDRXkeQYvrpEcA.text: Was in the area and wanted something nutritious and found this gem!  Ordered the nori rolls and although they took a while (just go in knowing it's food made from scratch and worth the wait!) they were so yummy!  It was a good amount for the price too.  Usually raw food is super pricey.  The guy at the counter was super nice and helpful as well!  He even introduced himself and shook my hand!  Not common for restaurants but it was a nice gesture!  Definitely will be back!

TbBz9hL3L8-LIs3clA2HuA.text: This place is THE BOMB. They have a huge menu full of plant based cuisine that tastes amazing for vegans and non-vegans alike. My husband adores the dan dan noodles. Today I got the "Biscuits and Groovy" which was biscuits and mushroom gravy topped with chicken and roasted root vegetables and some kind of tofu scramble... INCREDIBLE!

oLcZVQqwSu2b_dT1Tv9OSg.text: I called on a Tuesday, I recall, for a birthday cake to be made for a Saturday pick up.   The woman who helped me explained that normally they need a bit more notice but since it was a simple medium sized carrot cake, that it could be made in time.  I explained that I just needed something simple, but well made and ready for me to add candles.  She thought about it for a moment and then said she could do it.   What I received exceeded my expectations and helped make the birthday celebration extra special.  The cake was beautifully decorated, delicious, and exactly as large as was stated (was told it served 8, it ended up cutting into perfect eighth sized slices).   I would absolutely order a cake from 24 Carrots again, and would recommend their baking to anyone, vegan or not.    Thank you for the great cake and great service!

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States

SRrHnlZMirAoIRCS-HNdEg.text: So much yes!  I was not aware this place even existed until I told a friend I was heading back to Gilbert to visit a plant based eatery that I love. She mentioned there was a place up the street and we decided to feast.   Bright, clean interior. Friendly staff and a whole lot of items to choose from. I was decided upon their tacos that are on the menu, however when I saw that one of the specials were jackfruit BBQ tacos I decided to go for it. I am very glad that I did. I'd never had jackfruit before and was excited to give it a try.   The tortillas were small like street tacos and they were really good. There was a perfect amount of sauce on them and the BBQ wasn't overpowering, in fact I'd almost forgotten that they were BBQ apart from a sweet hint that came through ever few bites. The beans and rice were really good as well.   I also grabbed a Blue Pom Bomb juice, mmmmm. I appreciated that they had their juices separated by fruit and veggie options because I know there are times I shy away from the fruit juices.   The vibe was light, the food was great. I am so glad there are more and more places like this making plant based diets easier to follow while dining out.

photos.caption: Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Raw tacos - togo
Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Med Triple Threat Acai smoothie....  Mmmmm
Photo of 24 Carrots Juice Bar & Cafe - Tempe, AZ, United States. Jackfruit BBQ tacos side of beans and rice

0WP3mJEX48u4lza3yH2Crw.text: One of my friends introduced me to this vegan restaurant and I couldn't have been happier. First, I rarely go to vegan restaurants because I love my meats way to much, so I was willing to try something new. I was a little overwhelmed with the menu because everything sounded great. I ended up convincing myself to order an appetizer, a sandwich, dessert, and a drink.  My appetizer was the pepper poppers, which was five pieces of red pepper with spicy almond cheese, sesame seeds, and small pieces of dried fruit on top. I absolutely loved it because I'm a huge fan of spicy foods. The chef explained to us that they would have done jalapeno instead of red peppers, but they were apprehensive of the spice level.  I ordered the Nashville Chicken sandwich, which had faux chicken, pickles, tomatoes, and a house sauce that is on the spicier side. The chef was asking for my opinion on the level of crispiness of the chicken and it's definitely on the crispier side. However, that's how I like fried chicken. I understand that the level of crispiness can be subjective. I love the amount of house sauce they put on the sandwich. It was enough to taste and it didn't overpower the full taste of the sandwich.   My dessert was a tiramisu and it was absolutely delicious. The piece of cake was extremely moist and flavorful. My friend and I continue to rave about it.  The customer service was amazing and the atmosphere was quiet and relaxing. We went on a Thursday afternoon, so people were probably at work then.

oijq1eoEJxv26Gxmu03apg.text: My family and I have been back to 24 Carrots a dozen more times and they have won us over! They have changed their menu, and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND the hunny mustard pretzels. The watermelon iced tea is also amazing. One day while dining in, the chef introduced herself and checked in on us. She was the sweetest and I have never seen anyone take the time to do that. If you are in the area this place is worth a visit!

8NWmQgcKrLQblWwR-P_0KQ.text: Really great atomsphere! The food is really good, but a tad pricey. I understand vegan food normally has an upcharge, but just find it unreasonable to pay that much. The juices are really good, but again pricey for 16oz $8 when you can make three of them at home for that price. Paying for convenience.  Have had multiple times that the juice machince has been broken.  Still would recommend to check it out for the quality of food.

bNthB7-6i7VbhcUuOMTMAg.text: I love this place! I had the nachos and a berry up beat smoothie with lavender!  Best smoothie ever! The touch of lavender was like a (( hug)) for my soul

hCya4aRRm2nnzyFBpJAs9w.text: I can't get enough! Not only do they involve themselves in the community, but their portions, food, service, and the atmosphere are outstanding! My fave is the raw tacos supreme!

PsEnd-ldF4Z8U02gI1Do7g.text: It's like a pit stop in heaven for vegans. Plenty of options. Ordered - Laughing Buddha Bowl : tasted delicious. Cooked to perfection, ingredients blend together to give you mouth watering tastes. Served not too cold not too warm.  Cucumber Cool: obviously cucumber juices are my favorite things. Tasted good with parsley etc.  Why 4 stars?? I feel price is too much for the quantity. I could easily get ~2.5 meals outside for the price (not vegan obviously), but I'm also comparing it with other vegan restaurants.
